section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > j. Disseminated malignant neoplasm, unspecified

content.full_text: Code C80.0, Disseminated malignant neoplasm, unspecified, is for use only in those cases where the patient has advanced metastatic disease and no known primary or secondary sites are specified. It should not be used in place of assigning codes for the primary site and all known secondary sites. (Evidence: pg no: 36, L91-L92)
content.summary: Guidelines for using C80.0 for disseminated malignant neoplasm when specific sites are unknown (Evidence: pg no: 36, L91-L92)
key_concepts: Advanced metastatic disease (Evidence: pg no: 36, L92)
No known primary or secondary sites specified (Evidence: pg no: 36, L92)
Should not replace specific site codes (Evidence: pg no: 36, L92)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use C80.0 only when patient has advanced metastatic disease with no known primary or secondary sites specified (Evidence: pg no: 36, L92)
detailed_rules.explanation: C80.0 is reserved for cases where there is clearly advanced metastatic cancer but the specific sites cannot be determined or specified (Evidence: pg no: 36, L91-L92)
detailed_rules.applies_to: advanced metastatic disease of unknown sites
common_applications: Patient with widespread cancer but primary site unknown
Advanced cancer with multiple metastases but sites not specified

detailed_rules.rule_text: Should not be used in place of assigning codes for known primary and secondary sites (Evidence: pg no: 36, L92)
detailed_rules.explanation: When specific primary or secondary sites are known, those specific codes should be used instead of the unspecified disseminated code (Evidence: pg no: 36, L92)
detailed_rules.applies_to: cases with known primary or secondary sites
common_applications: Do not use when lung primary with liver metastases are known
Do not use when specific metastatic sites are documented

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm patient has advanced metastatic disease
Step 2: Verify no primary site is known or specified
Step 3: Verify no secondary sites are known or specified
Step 4: Only then consider using C80.0
Step 5: If any sites are known, use specific codes instead
